reviews.review_msg: Dr. Brockman seems to really care about his students. However, his lectures were confusing and his tests were much more detailed than he suggested they would be in class. Reading the textbook is a must, because he includes very specific details on the tests.

Mark is brilliant, friendly and cares that his students do well. The lecture material is dry and going to class is optional. Exams require a lot of memorizing. Big concepts for written but the multiple choice does test on some very small details (protein names) Final was simple - just study what is on his review sheet, no more than that.

Dr. Brockman is an amazing professor, he is very clear in every topic for each of the lectures and will help if you ask! His exams are fair but study the book and his notes vigorously if you want to do well in his exams! Everyone clapped at the end of his last lecture, that's how awesome he is!
Exams are very fair with only a few trick questions.  Class averages were very high although attendance was quite low.  Study notes and should be okay.

I found the material really interesting, but like most people I rarely attended lecture because he read straight off the notes. The material isn't really hard, but the class average was quite high on all exams, so you really have to know your stuff to do really well.
Dr. Brockman is a great professor who is very interested in what he teaches. He allowed us a cheat sheet on the final, which made the exam very easy. Recommended.

First time teach 322 this sem. He's very nice and has good notes. As for exams, its mostly fair with some trick questions. Had 3 midterms. Final exam was cumulative and much harder but was allowed one cheat sheet. Half the ppl dont show up to lecs cause its boring. Just study the notes well and you will do decent. Overall a good prof.
